decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful threat alongside aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Ranger-Captain of Eos. The deck also includes disruption in the form of cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand and remove key threats with cards like Path to Exile and Fatal Push. Additionally, the deck can dig for answers and pump up Death's Shadow with cards like Faithless Looting, Mishra's Bauble, and Street Wraith, while also disrupting the opponent's graveyard with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Surgical Extraction.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the graveyard as a resource to quickly fill it with creatures like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine using cards like Faithless Looting and Stitcher's Supplier, while also fueling Bridge from Below. The deck aims to combo off by sacrificing creatures to Altar of Dementia or Carrion Feeder, triggering multiple death and enter the battlefield effects. Leyline of the Void helps to disrupt opponent's graveyard strategies. Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis serves as a powerful threat that can be cast from the graveyard.

The core concept of this deck is to quickly play out a wide variety of aggressive Human creatures while utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls to make them difficult to counter. Cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant benefit from each creature played, while disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter help control the opponent's hand and board state. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent stream of threats while utilizing efficient spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour to bring back Arclight Phoenix from exile. Thing in the Ice helps control the board while Aria of Flame and Lightning Bolt provide additional damage. The deck also includes some control elements like Surgical Extraction to disrupt opponent's plans. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and consistent aggression, leveraging the synergy between spells and creatures to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells, trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard, and deal fast damage to the opponent using aggressive spells like Lightning Bolt and Aria of Flame. The deck also includes interaction through Surgical Extraction to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the board through Thing in the Ice while setting up for explosive turns with cards like Manamorphose and Finale of Promise. It focuses on speed and efficiency to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and control cards to achieve a strong board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer, Thopter Foundry, and Sword of the Meek, the deck can generate a constant stream of tokens while also maintaining control over the game with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Pithing Needle. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Engineer and Whir of Invention to search for key pieces and manipulate the board state as needed. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through its efficient artifact interactions.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of powerful Humans using cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mantis Rider. The deck uses mana-efficient creatures along with disruption spells like Meddling Mage and Deputy of Detention to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to get creatures onto the battlefield quickly and efficiently. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent and disrupt their plan while building a strong board presence with powerful Human creatures.

This deck focuses on quickly powering out Arclight Phoenix by discarding cards like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose. Cards like Thing in the Ice can help control the board while also enabling the Phoenix to return from the graveyard. The deck also utilizes spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart for direct damage and removal. Aria of Flame can provide reach and close out games quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient use of resources to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and trigger powerful effects from cards like Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame. Through card draw and manipulation, the deck seeks to efficiently cast spells and disrupt opponents with Surgical Extraction and Magmatic Sinkhole. Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart provide direct damage and removal, while Finale of Promise allows for explosive turns. The deck aims to apply pressure and control the board to secure victory through swift and aggressive plays.

The focus of this deck is on efficiently dealing damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using cheap and direct burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. This is complemented by aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear that can deal additional damage while applying pressure. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for casting spells, and lands like Sunbaked Canyon and Fiery Islet to ensure consistency in mana production. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and continuous damage output.

This deck focuses on quickly building up poison counters using creatures with infect, such as Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, combined with pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Scale Up. The inclusion of protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Giver of Runes helps to ensure that your infect creatures can connect with your opponent and deal lethal poison damage. Surgical Extraction can be used to disrupt your opponent's game plan, while cards like Become Immense provide a potential finisher in the late game.

The main idea behind this Modern 1 vs 1 Control Urza deck is to manipulate artifacts to control the board and generate value. By utilizing cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer, Thopter Foundry, and Goblin Engineer, the deck aims to control the game by generating thopter tokens, manipulating artifacts, and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of various artifacts like Mox Opal and Whir of Invention allows for flexibility in generating mana and accessing key cards. Overall, the deck focuses on using artifacts synergies to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Eldrazi creatures with efficient mana acceleration and disruption cards to disrupt your opponent's game plan and overwhelm them with powerful threats. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer while using cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember to disrupt your opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Serum Powder and Simian Spirit Guide also allows for explosive starts and consistent mana generation to consistently apply pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Dredge deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gravecrawler, and Vengevine in order to enable powerful combos with cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Bridge from Below. Altar of Dementia allows you to sacrifice creatures for additional graveyard synergy, while Leyline of the Void can disrupt opposing graveyard strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy that leverages the graveyard as a resource for explosive plays and combos.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Faithless Looting, then use the Dredge mechanic to bring back powerful creatures like Vengevine and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Bridge from Below and Altar of Dementia to generate additional value from sacrificing creatures. Leyline of the Void is included in the main deck to disrupt opponent graveyard strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive combo of graveyard recursion and sacrifice effects.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Stitcher's Supplier, Insolent Neonate, and Faithless Looting to enable the combo between Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis, Vengevine, and Bridge from Below. This allows the deck to rapidly bring back creatures from the graveyard, generating value and overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck also utilizes Altar of Dementia as a key piece to mill cards and further fuel the graveyard strategy. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently and aggressively leverage the graveyard as a resource to win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with a variety of aggressive human creatures, using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Champion of the Parish to disrupt opponents and pump up the team. Aether Vial and Unclaimed Territory help to accelerate creature deployment, while control elements like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage provide disruption and protection. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful army of humans, utilizing the tribal synergies and efficient mana base to maintain pressure and control the game.

This deck focuses on quickly pumping up creatures with infect, such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, to deal massive damage to opponents. Cards like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa provide additional boosts, while protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense help keep the creatures alive. Using Inkmoth Nexus as an alternate win condition, this combo-infect archetype aims to overwhelm opponents with poison counters before they have a chance to react. The deck also includes mana dorks like Noble Hierarch to accelerate the strategy and disruption spells like Spell Pierce to control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and trigger its ability. Cards like Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame help control the board while Lightning Bolt and other burn spells provide direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, utilizing powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The main concept of this aggro Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells using cards like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose, allowing players to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Surgical Extraction to disrupt opponent's game plan and cards like Aria of Flame for alternative win conditions. By utilizing efficient cantrips and removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and consistent aggression, while also disrupting their strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells such as Faithless Looting, Lightning Bolt, and Manamorphose to trigger the reanimation of Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. Thing in the Ice can act as a secondary win condition by transforming into Awoken Horror. Aria of Flame provides additional burn damage while also gaining counters for each spell cast, helping to close out the game. Surgical Extraction and Finale of Promise provide disruption and additional value, making this deck a formidable aggro strategy in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on assembling a variety of powerful creatures that can be fetched from the deck using a toolbox of creature tutoring cards such as Chord of Calling, Eladamri's Call, and Finale of Devastation. The key strategy is to quickly generate infinite mana with cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies, allowing for a combo finish with Walking Ballista. The deck also features support creatures like Noble Hierarch and Giver of Runes to protect and support the combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent by quickly assembling its powerful creature toolbox.

This deck focuses on quickly getting creatures onto the battlefield, utilizing efficient creatures like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to quickly build up a board presence. Using cards like Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat for mana acceleration and disruption, along with Cavern of Souls to make spells uncounterable, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive human creatures like Mantis Rider and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage to control the battlefield and keep opponents off balance.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard, while also dealing damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Manamorphose to quickly cycle through the deck and cast multiple spells in a turn. Additionally, cards like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike help to chip away at the opponent's life total, while Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage provide additional pressure on the board. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays and burn spells.
